snippet: President Thein Sein declared a state of emergency for the coastal state of Rakhine after at least 17 people were killed this month in violence between Buddhists and Muslims.
abstract: Myanmar Pres Thein Sein declares state of emergency for the coastal state of Rakhine, where at least 17 people have been killed in clashes between Buddhists and Muslims; violence underscores the long list of challenges and demands facing Thein Sein as he tries to open up the country after years of isolation under a military junta and steer it toward democracy.
lead_paragraph: President Thein Sein declared a state of emergency for the coastal state of Rakhine after at least 17 people were killed this month in violence between Buddhists and Muslims.

headline.seo: State of Emergency Declared in Western Myanmar
headline.main: Crisis in Myanmar Over Buddhist-Muslim Clash
headline.print_headline: Crisis in Myanmar Over Buddhist-Muslim Clash
